title: Looking for 2 Fonts
content:
Hi im trying to identify the 2 fonts used in this logo

Thanks in advance

Mark

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [New nicholsons logo CA & BA - White on Blue.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20131022102244/http:/typophile.com/files/New%20nicholsons%20logo%20CA%20&%20BA%20-%20White%20on%20Blue.jpg) | 166.14 KB |
author: macynwa

comments.content: Both look like [Helvetica Neue](http://web.archive.org/web/20131022102244/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/neue-helvetica) to me, Extended for "nicholson" and and UltraLight or Thin for the text.
_nicholson_ looks too bad to be a professional font.

> nicholson looks too bad to be a professional font.

I really see Helvetica everywhere recently... If it appears to be true, I really need to consult an ophthalmologist :D

But it also has features (like the gently modulated tops of the arch-stem joins) that very few -legitimate- free fonts enjoy. In fact the "c" (and to a lesser extent the "o") is the only really malformed glyph. The "s" -a very difficult letter to make well- is tellingly clean, it's just horizontally stretched.

So my guess is it's either a one-off logo based on a mainstream font, or yet another plagiarized/butchered free font.

hhp
